page.title: 11ANSLOW GATE
page.content:
{Anslow Church,}built in 1861 by Oswald Mosley, together with school and vicarage next to it, is distant from the village of Anslow. It shares a {vicar}with Rolleston church. There are{services}7 months of the year in church, but in winter it is closed and the Mission Room in the village is used. There is no longer a choir, but {funerals and weddings}can take place. The church benefits financially from the{Sophia Mosley Trust,}and employs a cleaner and gardener. There is a thriving{Sunday school and youth club, both held in the Mission Room.
{Bell House Farm and Lane}take their name from when a bell was rung to call in the workers from Needwood Forest. There are still{families}in the area today who were mentioned in the{first {Domesday Book.
